comment: You get graded on 3 tests, the final, like 3 homework assignments, and like 3 in-class assignments. You don't have to take the final if you average 90%ish on the 3 tests. She loves teaching and uses a ton of analogies. Very easy to understand most material except for the cellular respiration chapter. She doesn't mandate it, but read da textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Griffin is great for lecture and lab and she is very funny. Study a lot and really know your stuff because her test questions can be specific. Use PPts first and the textbook for things you don't understand. Ask her questions in office hours or after class she will spend as much time as you need! Her lab has prelab quizzes can be specific too.

Really great professor. You do need to know what you're doing for lab (i.e. read the lab beforehand) but she's incredibly helpful, walks you through labs so you can learn the technique, and is just all around great to learn from.

If she was actually caring, she'd be very understanding but she's not! She's inconsistent with her emails. I've emailed her many times & not once has she replied to any of my emails. Says attendance isn't a grade but it really is & that's why she gives in class assignments. Locks her lectures so you can't see it later. She also has a BAD attitude.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took her for micro lab. she really fights for you and tries to help her students do their best!! she answers questions and guides you through lab so you actually understand what is expected of you. BE PREPARED FOR PRE LAB /POST LAB Quizzes. I wouldn't say they're hard, But they are specific. you must read the lab before class to pass.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof Griffin is an amazing and caring professor. The material is not necessarily difficult but there is a lot of it. Her tests can be a little tricky but if you review the material and go to class you should be fine. Participation is a LARGE portion of your grade and don't think it does not matter much. I learned this too late.

I HIGHLY recommend to watch and LISTEN to her lectures. It took me the entire semester to figure out that the best way to study for her exams are to LISTEN to what she SAYS in her lectures, not just copy down what's written on the slides. I found her exams really challenging but she gives a good cushion with other assignments for your final grade.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Great professor for micro lecture. Three tests and a final. If the test avg are 90% you can exempt the final. Tests are MC, T/F, matching, and free response. The free response come from the textbook. There's also extra extra credit which helps tons!!!

Dr. Griffin is truly a fantastic professor. She takes long amounts of time on each slide and ensures that every point on the slide is addressed. Her tests are fair and have bonus questions. If your test average is a 90+ you can exempt the final! She is excited to teach which makes you excited to learn. Her in office hours isn't as great. Would take

Her tests do NOT come from powerpoints. Most of the info can be found in them, but you will fail essays and short answer questions if you did not read the book. honestly, it's better to read in her class than listen to lecture. allows you to average the final with lowest exam grade, but these exams are DETAILED
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Melanie Griffin is a KUHween! She is the most hilarious professor I have ever had, and she SUHlays in her high heels! Med micro was a lot more fun and interesting than gen micro. Her exams are no joke! Her T/F questions are VERY tricky. The lab was really fun because it was all discovery, and there were lab practicals. LOVED all the graphic images!

Not a big fan. very lecture heavy, just reads off her slides that she puts up later on d2l. Don't buy the book, her tests come right from the ppts. Material is not super complicated but definitely don't wait until the last minute to study. Her tests are harder than they need to be; I'm an A student, studied for hours, still got Bs/Cs
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: LOVE HER. Dr. Griffin is a passionate professor with the best intentions of teaching microbiology. Print out the lectures and listen! Take good notes and try not to stay behind. THIS CLASS IS NOT MEANT FOR LAST MINUTE STUDYING. I recommend getting a study buddy and explaining the concepts to each other.

I love Dr. Griffin! She cares about her students and makes herself accessible outside class if you need help. However her tests can be difficult and sometimes she'll only focus on half the material covered in class. Homework is mastering and not too difficult. At the end of the semester she dropped our lowest test grades just to be nice
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Loved Dr G for micro lab. Super nice, helpful, and caring. Engages a lot with the class so she likes participation and is even funny. Tricky prelab and okay postlab quizzes for every unit and the "final" is the identification of unknown bacteria. She gives you all you need to pass. An A is more than possible. Sometimes slow about grades and emails

To get an A in Dr. Griffin's microbiology class: Go to class, take notes, ask questions, read the textbook, and review her powerpoints. If you put the work in Dr. Griffin will notice and it will make the class much easier when you get into the more in depth micro topics
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Griffin was an alright professor. The class is just hard in general. And if you're a nursing student and you're doubling up it can be done. I took anatomy along with this class and made a B in both you just need to be focused. But overall just read and watch lectures on YouTube and go to class.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Enjoyed the class, great prof, lots of material. Be on time to class/lab.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great teacher. Really funny sometimes. She knows her stuff. But, very hard class. Dont dare doubling up with Anatomy. This class requires full attention on power points, textbook, mastering micro, and practice questions. Good luck

Expected to study book, study the hell out of Mastering Micro., study power points, etc. You need to know how to study effectively before taking this class otherwise you're wasting your time and $$. Like most other science classes-it's time consuming and you need to use all of your study resources to pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: I really enjoyed this class. The tests are difficult. There are four of them. For your tests, I recommend concentrating on the readings in the book more so than the powerpoints. Go through with a highlighter while reading and study what you highlighted. That's what I did, and I have an A. However, she's not super approachable.

Dr. G gives power points that you can study from, but use the book also she uses questions from the back of the chapter and NCLEX prep. She will answer any questions you have during class bur can be hard to approach after class. If you really listen to her passing the class shouldn't be a problem. Study hard with book and power points and get an A!

She makes her test very hard & tricky. She is slow to grade tests & also takes a long time to respond to emails. She seems nice but can be rude during one on one interactions.  You have to know almost exactly every single detail for tests because every question is tricky. Difficult class and tests but assignments are easy. I-clicker pts for grade!

Dr. Griffin is an amazing professor and definitely the ONLY choice to take, trust me, you're in good hands. Understand everything she teaches, the diagrams and figures. Take plenty of notes, GO TO CLASS, study, take every extra credit she gives and do well from the beginning. Tests: T and F, short answers, match and sometimes multiple choice.

DR. G is AMAZING!! Her exams are to the point (multiple choice, matching, true and false, correct the true and false and essays). She is an amazing lab professor as well. I loved her class and ended up with an 88. Truly wish I could have gotten those last 2 points.

Dr. G is amazing! I took her for a full year ( two separate classes). She's tricky, so watch out!  Her TF questions on her exams can get pretty tricky so know your stuff. If you want an A then you have to study the power points, take notes in class, and read the book. She has a lot of extra assignments that save your grade. I definitely recommend!

Always go to class/lab and always read the textbook. The exams can be pretty tricky but with all the extra grades, it is pretty easy to get an A if you do everything you're supposed to. Dr. Griffin seems like she'd be cool outside of class but it really bothered me how she never answers questions clearly and provides little studying direction.

I think the class is hard and she is the easiest of those teaching. But she is not easy. The only good thing about taking her is that the extra stuff other than tests are what pull you up a letter grade.

Dr. Griffin is an awesome professor. She knows her stuff, and makes the class interesting. It's a hard course, so make sure you spend a lot of time reading the text book and website for extra help. I expected to make a C in the class when I first started, but I studied almost everyday, and I ended up with an A. Take Dr. Griffin! She's great.

Dr. Griffin is a nice professor, and she tries to make the class more interesting. Read the book as an extra resource and understand the material. Watch out for her tricky questions on exams! Overall I highly recommend her!

Dr. Griffin loves micro and she wants you to love it. The class is about applying what she teaches you rather than memorizing the book. We didn't use the book much but when we did it was for take home assignments. Bottom line she is tough but she is the best and very much worth it.
Great professor!! Interesting class and she knows her stuff!! Offers a few extra credit points. Don't bother with the book. Take notes during lecture and study her power points and you can get an A.

Awesome professor. She cared about the subject matter, presented relevant information but added interesting tidbits as well, and has a good sense of humor. I really enjoyed taking her class. She's tough, but fair. A few questions can get a little tricky. Study hard and a good grade is in your grasp.

Very interesting class! Dr. Griffin made the material flow and gave interesting/relevant examples. Tests included some tricky questions, but there was opportunity to make up a few points. Enjoyed this class a lot and would definitely recommend Dr. Griffin.

Dr. G is amazing! Micro is NOT a hard class and her tests can be a little tricky, but if you pay attention, ask questions, GO TO LAB and READ THE BOOK, you'll do fine! There's a lot of opportunities to get a few points here and there just for attending lecture and those really help out. Don't limit yourself to her powerpoints.

Shes a wonderful professor!  She gives you the chance to exempt the final,tests are tricky, but relevently so.  You will learn alot and she really helps you want to learn it.  She makes it fun and interesting.  She is open to questions and knowlegable to the answers.  She is friendly and engaging professor.  I think shes the  best professor I've ha

By far the easiest class I have ever taken. She uses the same exams over and over so you really don't have to go to class. Just study the past exams and you'll fly by! Very easy! I recommend this class to everyone!!!
Awesome prof. Makes the material interesting! Be thorough on the essay portions of tests or she counts off. Study power points and you'll do great!

Dr Griffin is a great professor.  She is helpful, knowledgeable and straight forward.  She lets you know what she expects of you.  Her tests focus on what she has been lecturing on.  Make sure to keep up with the reading!!

Dr. Griffin is one of the best professors at KSU! I have had her for both Micro and Med Micro. She is very helpful and the material is very interesting. I plan on taking her for BTEC.  Take her class, you won't regret it!

Excellent Professor one of the best at Kennesaw. The class is very interesting. Material was taught in a clear manner. Tests were about 10 pages long not to hard though :( but overall lab was especially fun!!! I recommend taking Medical Micro with Dr. Griffin you will not regret it!!!
One of my favorite professors at KSU!  She is very helpful and does care how you do in her class!
good teacher learned alot tests can be hard, but worth it. drops an exam grade. lots of extra credit.
